q: Next up, Jaime Anderson tells me, they'll be making-over a pit bull in the wake of perpetually gauche Dwaine Caraway 's weekend spent buddying up to noted animal abuser and convicted felon Michael Vick . She writes: This will be more of an` image' makeover, but we plan to parade a pit around in a pink tutu and show how`` vicious' they really are( not)! Rescuers and shelter folks can head over to the Facebook page if they'd like to get their pups spruced up. If videos of rehabilitated dogs make your heart go pitter-patter, mark your calendars

assault on women's rights.'' The focus of the Democrats' criticism is the`` No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act,'' sponsored by Rep. Chris Smith( R-N.J.). The legislation would prohibit the expenditure of funds authorized or appropriated by federal law or funds in any trust fund to which funds are authorized or appropriated by federal law( federal funds) for any abortion. Prohibits federal funds from being used for any health benefits coverage that includes coverage of abortion. It would also re-install a ban on D.C. abortion funding. When asked how the Grand Wagoneer would differ from the seven-seat Jeep Commander, a widely panned vehicle Chrysler stopped making in 2010, Sergio Marchionne had some harsh words: That car was unfit for human consumption. We sold some. But I don't know why people bought them. games. At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile, Eric Schmidt said.`` These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth- investments that will benefit our users, Google Inc. and the wider web,'' he said.
